meta.title: Air Quality Solutions & Monitoring For Office | Corporates | Prana Air
meta.description: Prana Air delivers clean, fresh office air with real-time air quality monitoring and HEPA filter and UV disinfection in our machines.

animalCare.title: Air quality Solutions for Animal care

officeBanner.title: Air quality solutions for
officeBanner.description: A complete solution for air quality monitoring, data analysis, and fresh air solutions in workplaces prioritizing employees health and productivity.

officeFactors.title: Factors affecting the health of
officeFactors.description: Exposure to air pollution in offices can lead to a range of health problems, including respiratory infections, headaches, fatigue, and difficulty concentrating.

pm.title: PM
pm.description: Fine particulate matter in an office environment primarily originates from outdoor air

co2.title: CO2
co2.description: Office CO2 originates from occupants respiration and is influenced by ventilation.

vocs.title: VOCs
vocs.description: Arises from office materials, equipment, cleaning agents, and personal care products.

hcho.title: HCHO
hcho.description: Found in office environment through off-gassing of furniture and carpets.

ozone.title: Ozone
ozone.description: Typically a byproduct of office equipment like printers and copiers

humidity.title: Humidity
humidity.description: Indoor levels vary based on building design, occupancy, and weather.

temperature.title: Temperature
temperature.description: Regulated by HVAC systems, weather, and heat from equipment and occupants

noise.title: Noise
noise.description: Comes from office machinery, HVAC systems, conversations, and external sources.

pm.title: PM & PM10
pm.description: Harms breathing, heart, and cardiovascular health

vocs.title: VOCs
vocs.description: Irritates eyes, nose, throat, some carcinogenic

temperature.title: Temperature
temperature.description: Impacts mood, focus, productivity, risks heat illnesses

noise.title: Noise
noise.description: Raises stress, hampers focus, affects mental health

irritation.title: Eye, nose, and throat irritation
irritation.description: Air pollutants can also irritate the eyes, nose, and throat, causing symptoms such as redness, watering, burning, and sneezing.

respiratory.title: Respiratory problems
respiratory.description: Air pollutants can irritate the airways & lungs leading to coughing, shortness of breath, & chest tightness.

cardiovascular.title: Cardiovascular problems
cardiovascular.description: Short-term exposure to air pollution can increase the risk of heart attacks, strokes, and other cardiovascular events.

headaches.title: Headaches
headaches.description: Air pollutants that can cause headaches include PM2.5, NO2, and O3, that irritate the lining of the nose and throat.

respiratory.title: Chronic respiratory diseases
respiratory.description: Air pollutants can damage the lungs, leading to chronic respiratory diseases such as asthma, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), and lung cancer.

other.title: Other health problems
other.description: Air pollutants have also been linked to a number of other health problems, including diabetes, reproductive problems, and neurological problems.

officePollutionSources.title: Sources of air pollution in
officePollutionSources.description: Offices can be polluted by building materials, office equipment, personal care products, cigarette smoke, and outdoor air. These pollutants can irritate the eyes, nose, throat, and respiratory system, and can also cause headaches, dizziness, nausea, and asthma attacks.

equipment.title: Office equipment
equipment.description: Printers, photocopiers, and computers can emit VOCs, ozone, and nitrogen dioxide.

cleaning.title: Cleaning products
cleaning.description: Many cleaning products contain VOCs, which can irritate the eyes, nose, and throat.

dusting.title: Dusting
dusting.description: Dust can contain mold spores, bacteria, and other pollutants that can irritate the airways.

occupancy.title: High occupancy
occupancy.description: High levels of CO2 can cause headaches, dizziness, nausea, reduced productivity, and other health problems.

officeSolutions.title: Air Quality
officeSolutions.description: Prana Air offers air quality solutions for offices, including air quality monitors and fresh air machines. These solutions can improve air quality, reduce health risks, increase productivity, and reduce sick days.

freshAir.title: Fresh Air Machine
freshAir.description: It is an advanced air purifier designed to bring in fresh outdoor air and filter out pollutants, allergens, odors and enough oxygen.

officeComparison.title: The
officeComparison.description: Prana Air fresh air machine offer several benefits for office environments, including improved air quality, reduced illnesses, and increased productivity. Here, you can see the differences of impacts.

studies.study1: A study by the Harvard School of Public Health found that workers in offices with good air quality were 10% more productive than workers in offices with poor air quality.
studies.study2: Another study by the University of California, Berkeley found that workers in offices with fresh air machines had a 30% lower risk of developing asthma than workers in offices without fresh air machines.

officeDataServices.title: Freemium
officeDataServices.description: You can display or analyze air quality data for your office on LCD screens or in AQI App and our web-dashboards.

officeFaq.description: About Air Quality Solution for offices / corporates. Have questions? Were here to help.

questions.q1: 1. What is office air pollution, and how does it affect employees?
questions.q2: 2. Why is an Air Quality Monitor essential for offices?
questions.q3: 3. How does Prana Airs Air Quality Monitor work?
questions.q4: 4. What are the benefits of Prana Airs Air Quality Monitor?
questions.q5: 5. What is Prana Airs Fresh Air Machine, and how does it enhance office air quality?

answers.a1: Office air pollution is harmful indoor contaminants that can cause respiratory problems, allergies, headaches, and reduced productivity among employees.
answers.a2: An Air Quality Monitor tracks indoor pollutants in real-time, ensuring a healthy work environment by identifying and addressing air quality issues promptly.
answers.a3: Prana Airs monitor uses advanced sensors to detect pollutants like PM2.5, PM10, CO2, VOCs, and temperature, providing real-time data via a user-friendly interface and app.
answers.a4: It enables data-driven decisions for better air quality, leading to healthier employees and increased productivity.
answers.a5: Prana Airs Fresh Air Machine filters outdoor air, removing pollutants and maintaining a constant supply of clean air indoors, promoting better respiratory health.

industrial.title: Industrial
industrial.description: Regardless of how small or large a business is, Prana Air offers a wide choice of Smart, affordable, and highly accurate air quality solutions for various industries.
